summary: Client process exits with status 0 when calling start() or execute() with an unresolvable DNS address, instead of rejecting the promise with an error.
userImpact: Users experience silent process termination instead of proper error handling when DNS resolution fails, making debugging difficult.
rootCause: Issue in makeGrpcRetryInterceptor, specifically at line 103 in grpc-retry.ts that causes improper error handling for unresolvable addresses.
proposedFix: Fix the interceptor logic; connection constructor will be changed to async factory soon which will resolve this issue.
workaround: Setting interceptors to an empty array causes the call to fail with a ServiceError as expected.
resolutionDetails: Issue no longer occurs after upgrading grpc-js.
keyQuote: Setting the Connection address to an address that won't resolve causes subsequent start and execute calls from the client to exit the process.
